result.execSummary:
The defendant Catrina L. Macareno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Do not drive without a valid license.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Per P&P agent Kelly Euler the DE has paid all outstanding monies due.  Therefore, the probation review hearing scheduled for 12/1/17 @ 11:30 is being taken off of the calendar.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk
kmk

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. stipulates to State's motion to revoke hold open agreement.  Court enters judgment on the guilty plea that was entered on 6/3/16.  Sentenced to serve 60 days in Co. Jail; sentence is stayed, def. placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.  Cash bond in this file and file 16CM1299 to apply to costs due in both files; any balance to be returned to the poster.
Motion hearing on December 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Atty. James Fields-Bowers appeared on behalf of the DE who did not appear.  However, a court notice was not sent only a DA notice was sent.  Motion hearing rescheduled to 12/13/16 @ 2:00.
To reveoke stipulated hold open agreement - filed by ADA Zapf

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Catrina L. Macareno, appeared with Attorney James LeRoy Fields-Bowers.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; judgment is withheld and parties enter into a Stipulated Hold Open Agreement for 12 months.  Bond continues.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Catrina L. Macareno, appeared with Attorney James LeRoy Fields-Bowers.  Clerk: PT
Atty Fields-Bowers states case will be resolving with a DPA agreement and requests an adjournment in which ADA Binger concurs.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Catrina L. Macareno, appeared with Attorney James LeRoy Fields-Bowers.  Clerk: PT
Atty Fields-Bowers states he is working with the IT Dept. to review the video and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 09:40 am.

943.20(1m)(b) - Misd theft/ PTAC

2:04 pm    Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Clerk:  JT.  Plea of not guilty entered.  Deft demands jury trial,.  FPT 2-18-16 @ 11:00 am with 16CF64. $200 cash bond contd posted with conditions.
